verse_data: तत्र गत्वा यथोक्तं स पुर्या द्वारे महायशाः

verse_translation.google_trans: He went there as he had said, the great fame at the gate of the city. Remembering the words of Narada, he placed the Kunpa.

verse_data: ततः स कुणपं दृष्ट्वा सहसा स न्यवर्तत

verse_translation.google_trans: By the combination of simultaneously the brahmin entered the gate of the city Then he saw Kunapa and suddenly returned
He looked at him with folded hands and followed him with folded hands The king who was unseen to teach Samvarta

verse_data: स एनं विजने दृष्ट्वा पांसुभिः कर्दमेन च

verse_translation.google_trans: He saw him in the desert with dust and Kardama He also scattered the king with mucus
He was so obstructed by the king by Samvarta He followed the sage with folded hands
Then Samvarta retired and sat down tired The cold shade reached the banyan tree with many branches
Samvarta said

verse_data: कथमस्मि त्वया ज्ञातः केन वा कथितोऽस्मि ते

verse_translation.google_trans: How have you known me or by whom I have told you Tell me this, if you want the truth, I’m pleasing to me.

verse_data: सत्यं ते ब्रुवतः सर्वे संपत्स्यन्ते मनोरथाः
मिथ्या तु ब्रुवतो मूर्धा सप्तधा ते फलिष्यति

verse_translation.google_trans: The truth will all fulfill your desires when they speak the truth But the head of the speaker will bear fruit in seven ways
Marutta said

verse_data: गुरुपुत्रो ममेति त्वं ततो मे प्रीतिरुत्तमा

verse_translation.google_trans: Narada has told me about the path. You are my teacher's son, and then I love my love
Samvarta said

verse_data: कथयस्वैतदेकं मे क्व नु संप्रति नारदः

verse_translation.google_trans: True, he said, He knows me, the satri. Tell me this one of me where Narada is now
Marutta said
After telling you, my dear Devarshi, Then he entered me and entered the sacrificial vehicle
Vyasa said
Hearing this, this is the case with the utmost joy. I shall do this so far, he said,
Then he was mad at the dead and rebuked him with his words The Brahmin, the king, again said again to the chariot.
By the wind-principal I am subject to my mind How do you want to sacrifice this in a distorted form

verse_data: भ्राता मम समर्थश्च वासवेन च सत्कृतः
वर्तते याजने चैव तेन कर्माणि कारय

verse_translation.google_trans: My brother is capable of me and honored by Vasava There is also in the sacrifice, and he performs his actions

verse_data: गृहं स्वं चैव याज्याश्च सर्वा गृह्याश्च देवताः

verse_translation.google_trans: The house is his own and all the sacrifices and the gods are the householders This is the exclusion of my body thrown by my ancestors

verse_data: याजयेयं कथंचिद्वै स हि पूज्यतमो मम

verse_translation.google_trans: I have never seen you without permission I will sacrifice somehow, for he is the most revered.

verse_data: स त्वं बृहस्पतिं गच्छ तमनुज्ञाप्य चाव्रज

verse_translation.google_trans: That you go to Brihaspati and go to him with permission Then I will sacrifice you if you want to sacrifice here
Marutta said
I went to Brihaspati in the past, and listen to it, listen to it. He does not desire me, for he is forbidden by Vasava.

verse_data: अमरं याज्यमासाद्य मामृषे मा स्म मानुषम्

verse_translation.google_trans: I have attained the immortal sacrifice and do not be a human being You should sacrifice the Maruts, the mother of mortality.

verse_data: स्पर्धते च मया विप्र सदा वै स हि पार्थिवः

verse_translation.google_trans: And I always compete, O Brahmin, for he is the earthly one. And so it is said by your brother, Balavritraha.
He doesn’t bug like a sacrifice with love that he has come to me Know that the king of the gods is the best of sages.
So I want to sacrifice all of you I wish to cross the Vasava with the virtues you have done

verse_data: न हि मे वर्तते बुद्धिर्गन्तुं ब्रह्मन्बृहस्पतिम्

verse_translation.google_trans: I have no intelligence to go to Brihaspati, O Brahman. For I am rejected by him in such a way
Samvarta said
You want to do as you please all this is certain for you. If you are the doer of all the intentions
I have sacrificed you, O Brihaspati Purandara. Support one of these two-headed ones who are equally angry

verse_data: स्थैर्यमत्र कथं ते स्यात्स त्वं निःसंशयं कुरु
कुपितस्त्वां न हीदानीं भस्म कुर्यां सबान्धवम्

verse_translation.google_trans: How can you be here without doubt I’m angry with you and I’ll burn you now to ashes my relatives
Marutta said
As long as the mountains are heat and the mountains will stand I will not get the world until then if I am combined

verse_data: सम्यग्ज्ञाने वैषये वा त्यजेयं संगतं यदि

verse_translation.google_trans: I shall never find good intelligence here in any way If I should give up in perfect knowledge or in the subject
Samvarta said

verse_data: याजनं हि ममाप्येवं वर्तते त्वयि पार्थिव

verse_translation.google_trans: Avikshita shubha buddhi dhiyatam tava karmasu For the sacrifice is also mine in you, O earthly one.
And I will arrange you, O king, the inexhaustible matter. By which you will attack the gods, the Gandharvas and Indra.

verse_data: न तु मे वर्तते बुद्धिर्धने याज्येषु वा पुनः

verse_translation.google_trans: I have no intelligence in wealth or in sacrifices again I want to displeasure to my brother and Indra of both of them

verse_data: प्रियं च ते करिष्यामि सत्यमेतद्ब्रवीमि ते

verse_translation.google_trans: I will go with Indra, even if you are equal to you. I will do what you please you and I tell you the truth
Samvarta said
The mountain called Munjavan on the back of the mountains Where the Lord is performing austerities, the eternal Umapati
In the roots of the plants and in the peaks In the caves, the king of the mountains as he pleases as he pleases.
Lord Umasahaya, the Lord, is always there, Lord Maheshwara There is a spear, a very brilliant, covered with various ghosts.
There are the Rudras, Sadhyas, Visves, and Vasavas. Yama and Varuna and Kubera and Sahanuga
Ghosts and devils are not untrue Gandharvas, Apsaras, Yakshas and Devarshis
The suns and the Maruts and the demons in all respects They worship the great soul Mumapati
The Lord enjoys there with the followers of Kubera The distorted and distorted shapes, O lord of the earth, The brightness of the beauty of the sun is as bright as the brightness of beauty

verse_data: न रूपं दृश्यते तस्य संस्थानं वा कथंचन

verse_translation.google_trans: No form appears in his institution or somehow To direct by some creatures, by the flesh-eyes of the natural.

verse_data: नोष्णं न शिशिरं तत्र न वायुर्न च भास्करः
न जरा क्षुत्पिपासे वा न मृत्युर्न भयं नृप

verse_translation.google_trans: There is no hot, no winter, no air, no sun. I have no old age, hunger, thirst, death or fear, O king.

verse_data: तस्य शैलस्य पार्श्वेषु सर्वेषु जयतां वर

verse_translation.google_trans: May the best of all that rock beside him. The metals of the golden form of the sun are like the sun
They are protected by the help of Kubera with their weapons The chikirshads are dear to the great king Kubera

verse_data: तस्मै भगवते कृत्वा नमः शर्वाय वेधसे

verse_translation.google_trans: O Lord, I offer my obeisances to the Lord Vedhasa Rudraya Shitikanthaya Surupaya Suvarchase

verse_data: त्र्यक्ष्णे पूष्णो दन्तभिदे वामनाय शिवाय च

verse_translation.google_trans: Kapardine karala haryakshne varadaya cha Trikshne Pooshno Dantabhide Vamanaya Shivaaya Cha
Yamyayavyaktakeshaya sadvrtte shankaraya cha O Khemya, Harinetra, Sthana and Puruṣa
Harikeshaya Mundaaya Krishayottaranaya Cha Bhaskaraaya Sutirthaya Devadevaaya Ranhase
Ushnishine Suvaktraaya Sahasrakshaya Meedhushe Girishaya, the peaceful Yata, the dress of the chicken.
Bilvadandaaya siddhaaya sarvadandadharaya cha The deer hunting of the great bow and to the future
O boon, gentle-faced, animal-handed, rain Hiranyabahva Rajannugraaya Pataya Disham

verse_data: पशूनां पतये चैव भूतानां पतये तथा

verse_translation.google_trans: O lord of the animals and to the lord of beings bull to the mother-devoted army and to the middle
Sruvahastaaya pataya dhanvine bhargavaya cha Ajaya, the black-eyed, and the Virupaksha.
to sharp teeth, sharp and Vaisvanaramukha. O greatly bright, for the unconnected, to all the limbs, to the progeny.
and to the lord of the sperm, the earth of Krittivasa and for the skull garland and for the ever-crowned crown
Mahadevaya Krishnaaya Tryambakayanaghaya Cha to anger, the cruel, the soft, the arm-shaped.
Dandine, burning austerities, and so on for cruel deeds Sahasrashirasa chaivasahasracharanaya cha Ome Svadhasvaroopaya Bahurupaya Danshrine
Pinakin, Mahadeva, the great yogi, the inexhaustible Trishulapanim varada tryambakam bhuvanesvaraam
Tripuraghnam Trinayanam Trilokesh Mahaujasam The origin of all beings, the holder of the earth.

verse_data: ईशानं शंकरं सर्वं शिवं विश्वेश्वरं भवम्

verse_translation.google_trans: Ishaan Shankaram sarvam shivam visvesvara bhavam bhavam Umapati, Pashupati, Visvaroopa Maheshwaram

verse_data: उग्रं स्थाणुं शिवं घोरं शर्वं गौरीशमीश्वरम्

verse_translation.google_trans: Virupaksha, ten-armed, Tishyagovrishabhadhvajam. The fierce, stable, Shiva, the terrible Sharva, the lord of Gauri.
Shitikanthamaja, Shukra, Pruthu, Pruthuhara, Haram Visvaroopa Virupaksham Bahurupamumapatim
Bowing his head to the god, the destroyer of the limbs of the body. Go to the refuge of the four-faced Mahadeva.
Having done this, I offer my obeisances to the great god. O great lord of the earth you will get that gold Let those men go there who will take gold
Vyasa said
Thus addressed, the son of Karndhama was in the wheel. Then he made all the excessive humans in the sacrifice of the sacrifice The craftsmen made golden vessels there
Brihaspati, however, heard the king of the Maruts. Prosperously, he was tormented by the gods.

verse_data: भविष्यति हि मे शत्रुः संवर्तो वसुमानिति

verse_translation.google_trans: He was tormented and thin and became thin. For my enemy will be Samvarta Vasumani
Hearing that, the king of the gods, Brihaspati, was very tormented. Approaching the immortals, he spoke these words.
Indra said

verse_data: कच्चित्सुखं स्वपिषि त्वं बृहस्पते; कच्चिन्मनोज्ञाः परिचारकास्ते

verse_translation.google_trans: I hope you sleep happily, O Brihaspati;I hope you are pleasant to the attendants I trust you, O Brahmin, desire the happiness of the gods;I hope the gods protect you
Brihaspati said

verse_data: सुखं शयेऽहं शयने महेन्द्र; तथा मनोज्ञाः परिचारका मे
तथा देवानां सुखकामोऽस्मि शक्र; देवाश्च मां सुभृशं पालयन्ति

verse_translation.google_trans: I lay happily in bed, Mahendra;and the charming attendants. and I am Indra, who desires the happiness of the gods;The gods also protect me
Indra said

verse_data: कुतो दुःखं मानसं देहजं वा; पाण्डुर्विवर्णश्च कुतस्त्वमद्य
आचक्ष्व मे तद्द्विज यावदेता;न्निहन्मि सर्वांस्तव दुःखकर्तॄन्

verse_translation.google_trans: Where is suffering, mental or body;Where are you white and discolored today Tell me that, O Brāhmaṇa, as long as these;
Brihaspati said

verse_data: तं संवर्तो याजयितेति मे श्रुतं; तदिच्छामि न स तं याजयेत

verse_translation.google_trans: Maruttamahu Maghavanyakshyamana;Mahayajnanettamadakshinena I have heard that Samvarto sacrificed him;I want that he should not sacrifice him
Indra said

verse_data: सर्वान्कामाननुजातोऽसि विप्र; यस्त्वं देवानां मन्त्रयसे पुरोधाः
उभौ च ते जन्ममृत्यू व्यतीतौ; किं संवर्तस्तव कर्ताद्य विप्र

verse_translation.google_trans: You are born of all desires, O Brahmin;You are the priests who are consulting the gods and both of them passed away;What Samvarta is your doer today, O Brahmin
Brihaspati said

verse_data: यं यं समृद्धं पश्यसि तत्र तत्र; दुःखं सपत्नेषु समृद्धभावः

verse_translation.google_trans: With the gods, you threw the demons;Jighansase's still accommodate the conjunctions Whoever you see there and there;Suffering is a prosperous sense of enemies

verse_data: अतोऽस्मि देवेन्द्र विवर्णरूपः; सपत्नो मे वर्धते तन्निशम्य
सर्वोपायैर्मघवन्संनियच्छ; संवर्तं वा पार्थिवं वा मरुत्तम्

verse_translation.google_trans: That is why I am the lord of the gods, the discolored form;I hear that my enemies are growing By all means, the Maghavanniyachcha;Samvartam or earthly Marutta
Indra said

verse_data: एहि गच्छ प्रहितो जातवेदो; बृहस्पतिं परिदातुं मरुत्ते
अयं वै त्वा याजयिता बृहस्पति;स्तथामरं चैव करिष्यतीति

verse_translation.google_trans: Come, go, sent, Jatavedo;Marutte to give the Brihaspati This is the sacrifice of Brihaspati;
Agniruvacha

verse_data: अयं गच्छामि तव शक्राद्य दूतो; बृहस्पतिं परिदातुं मरुत्ते
वाचं सत्यां पुरुहूतस्य कर्तुं; बृहस्पतेश्चापचितिं चिकीर्षुः

verse_translation.google_trans: This is your messenger today, Indra;Marutte to give the Brihaspati to do the truth of the truth of the Puruhuta;They wanted to choose Brihaspati
Vyasa said
Then the great Dhoomaketu went away;The plants and the crushed snowflakes changed at the end of lust;Kashtatigo matarishva nardan
Marutta said

verse_data: आसनं सलिलं पाद्यं गां चोपानय वै मुने

verse_translation.google_trans: I see a wonder today that the form has come to the fire Choose the seat, water, foot-washing, cow, O sage.
Agniruvacha

verse_data: इन्द्रेण तु समादिष्टं विद्धि मां दूतमागतम्

verse_translation.google_trans: I rejoice in the seat, water and footsteps, O sinless one Know that Indra has come to me as a messenger.
Marutta said

verse_data: कच्चिद्देवाश्चास्य वशे यथाव;त्तद्ब्रूहि त्वं मम कार्त्स्न्येन देव

verse_translation.google_trans: I trust the king of the gods and happy;I hope you are pleased with the smoke I hope the gods are under his control;
Agniruvacha

verse_data: शक्रो भृशं सुसुखी पार्थिवेन्द्र; प्रीतिं चेच्छत्यजरां वै त्वया सः
देवाश्च सर्वे वशगास्तस्य राज;न्संदेशं त्वं शृणु मे देवराज्ञः

verse_translation.google_trans: Shakra is very happy, the earthly king;If he wants to love, he is your old man. and all the gods are subdued by him, O king;

verse_data: यदर्थं मां प्राहिणोत्त्वत्सकाशं; बृहस्पतिं परिदातुं मरुत्ते
अयं गुरुर्याजयिता नृप त्वां; मर्त्यं सन्तममरं त्वां करोतु

verse_translation.google_trans: for which he sent me to you;Marutte to give the Brihaspati This teacher has conquered you, O king;May the mortal saint make you immortal
Marutta said

verse_data: संवर्तोऽयं याजयिता द्विजो मे; बृहस्पतेरञ्जलिरेष तस्य
नासौ देवं याजयित्वा महेन्द्रं; मर्त्यं सन्तं याजयन्नद्य शोभेत्

verse_translation.google_trans: This Samvarta is sacrificed to me;Brihaspatiraanjaliresha tasya tasya He did not sacrifice the god Mahendra;He should sacrifice mortal saints today
Agniruvacha

verse_data: ये वै लोका देवलोके महान्तः; संप्राप्स्यसे तान्देवराजप्रसादात्
त्वां चेदसौ याजयेद्वै बृहस्पति;र्नूनं स्वर्गं त्वं जयेः कीर्तियुक्तः

verse_translation.google_trans: They are the great worlds in the heavens;You will get them by the grace of the king of the gods If he sacrifices you, Brihaspati;

verse_data: तथा लोका मानुषा ये च दिव्याः; प्रजापतेश्चापि ये वै महान्तः
ते ते जिता देवराज्यं च कृत्स्नं; बृहस्पतिश्चेद्याजयेत्त्वां नरेन्द्र

verse_translation.google_trans: and the worlds are human beings and divine;and the great creatures who are great They have conquered the kingdom of the gods and the whole;If Brihaspati offers you, O king
Samvarta said

verse_data: मास्मानेवं त्वं पुनरागाः कथंचि;द्बृहस्पतिं परिदातुं मरुत्ते
मा त्वां धक्ष्ये चक्षुषा दारुणेन; संक्रुद्धोऽहं पावक तन्निबोध

verse_translation.google_trans: Don’t be so again, O Marutte to give it to Brihaspati somehow; Do not burn you with your terrible eyes;I am angry, O fire, understand that.
Vyasa said

verse_data: तं वै दृष्ट्वा प्राह शक्रो महात्मा; बृहस्पतेः संनिधौ हव्यवाहम्

verse_translation.google_trans: Then the gods went to Dhumaketu; Seeing him, Shakra was a great man;Havyavaham in the presence of Brihaspati

verse_data: यत्त्वं गतः प्रहितो जातवेदो; बृहस्पतिं परिदातुं मरुत्ते
तत्किं प्राह स नृपो यक्ष्यमाणः; कच्चिद्वचः प्रतिगृह्णाति तच्च

verse_translation.google_trans: That which you have gone sent, Jatavedo;Marutte to give the Brihaspati What did the king say to him?I hope the words of the Lord accept it
Agniruvacha

verse_data: न ते वाचं रोचयते मरुत्तो; बृहस्पतेरञ्जलिं प्राहिणोत्सः
संवर्तो मां याजयितेत्यभीक्ष्णं; पुनः पुनः स मया प्रोच्यमानः

verse_translation.google_trans: The Maruts do not like your words;Brihaspati slipped his hands. Samvarto me to sacrifice me;Again and again he was told by me

verse_data: उवाचेदं मानुषा ये च दिव्याः; प्रजापतेर्ये च लोका महान्तः
तांश्चेल्लभेयं संविदं तेन कृत्वा; तथापि नेच्छेयमिति प्रतीतः

verse_translation.google_trans: He said this to the humans and those who are divine;Prajapatiye cha loka mahatato If they have found them, I have made a contract with it;However, it is believed that I should not want
Indra said

verse_data: पुनर्भवान्पार्थिवं तं समेत्य; वाक्यं मदीयं प्रापय स्वार्थयुक्तम्
पुनर्यद्युक्तो न करिष्यते वच;स्ततो वज्रं संप्रहर्तास्मि तस्मै

verse_translation.google_trans: Again, you gathered to the earth;Get my sentence with selfishness Again, what he is said will not do;
Agniruvacha

verse_data: गन्धर्वराड्यात्वयं तत्र दूतो; बिभेम्यहं वासव तत्र गन्तुम्

verse_translation.google_trans: You are a messenger of the Gandharvas and the king;I am afraid, Vasava, to go there Angered, he told me, with a sharp anger;Samvarta Vakya Charitabrahmacharya

verse_data: दहेयं त्वां चक्षुषा दारुणेन; संक्रुद्ध इत्येतदवैहि शक्र

verse_translation.google_trans: If you come again, you have somehow; I shall burn you with my eyes terrible;Sanchruddha ityadavahi shakra
Indra said

verse_data: त्वमेवान्यान्दहसे जातवेदो; न हि त्वदन्यो विद्यते भस्मकर्ता

verse_translation.google_trans: You are the one who burns others, Jatavedo;For there is no other ashes other than you From your touch all the worlds are afraid;
Agniruvacha

verse_data: दिवं देवेन्द्र पृथिवीं चैव सर्वां; संवेष्टयेस्त्वं स्वबलेनैव शक्र

verse_translation.google_trans: Heaven, O lord of the gods, and all the earth;Envelop you with your own strength, Shakra Such here in the Sattavasa;How did Vritra have prepared the heavens
Indra said

verse_data: न चण्डिका जङ्गमा नो करेणु;र्न वारिसोमं प्रपिबामि वह्ने

Thus, in the present Mahadhvara of the Tvagastya of the Tvagastya Sahasraksha did not rain, then, O best of Bharatas.
Then, in the next action, O King, of the great Agastya This is the story of the sages of the future.

verse_data: न च वर्षति पर्जन्यः कथमन्नं भविष्यति

verse_translation.google_trans: Agastya, the priest, gives us food without envy. Nor does the rainy season not rain
If this is a great widow, the sage is twelve years old. The god will not rain these twelve years
This is what you think of the wise Maharshi They deserve to do the grace of Agastya’s excessive austerities

verse_data: प्रोवाचेदं वचो वाग्मी प्रसाद्य शिरसा मुनीन्

verse_translation.google_trans: In the words thus spoken, Agastya was glorious He spoke to the words of the words of the speaker with his head
If Vasava will not rain for twelve years I will do the sacrifice of anxiety, this is the eternal method.
If Vasava will not rain for twelve years I will take away the sacrifices of other sacrifices by exercise.

verse_data: बीजैः कृतैः करिष्ये च नात्र विघ्नो भविष्यति

verse_translation.google_trans: I have acquired this seed sacrifice for many years I will do it with the seeds and I will not be hindered here

verse_data: नेदं शक्यं वृथा कर्तुं मम सत्रं कथंचन
वर्षिष्यतीह वा देवो न वा देवो भविष्यति

verse_translation.google_trans: This is not possible for my session in vain in any way Whether it will rain here or the god will not be the god
Atha vabhyarthanamindrah kurya na tpih kamata I will be Indra myself and I will live and the people

verse_data: विशेषं चैव कर्तास्मि पुनः पुनरतीव हि

verse_translation.google_trans: He who is born of food will be the same I am the doer of the special and again and again.
Let the gold here come here and whatever else is rare in the wealth And whatever is in the three worlds is the one who comes here himself

verse_data: विश्वावसुश्च ये चान्ये तेऽप्युपासन्तु वः सदा

verse_translation.google_trans: The divine and the nymphs are the gandharvas and the sakinras May Visvavasu and others who are others worship you always
From the north and the Kurus, whatever is in the earth Everything is here in the sacrifice, and let me come to me yourself. Heaven and heaven and religion and religion itself
That is, all this happened to the wise man Then the sages saw the sage’s strength The astonished words say this all of them are greatly meaningful

verse_data: प्रीताः स्म तव वाक्येन न त्विच्छामस्तपोव्ययम्

verse_translation.google_trans: We are pleased with your words, but we do not wish to expend your austerities We are satisfied with our own sacrifices and we wish to be just
We hunt the sacrificial initiations and the offerings. Let us not seek anything else by our own sacrifices performed by ourselves
We are engaged in our own actions by logic with justice And we pray for the Vedas according to celibacy
We have emerged from home for the latter time by justice We shall perform austerities by the methods seen by the Dharma
Your right intelligence is devoid of violence Tell me this violence in the sacrifices, O Lord, always
Please then will be the best of the Brāhmaṇas We are discharged and completed in the session from us.
Vaishampayana said
And let the king of the gods, Purandara, be told. He rained very bright and saw his penance force
and in the unfinished sacrifice, the immeasurable prowess of it Nikamavarshi Devendra became Janamejaya
The Lord of the gods pleased Tama Agastya He himself approached Brihaspati in the Rajarshi
Then at the end of the sacrifice he dismissed the great sages Agastya was very pleased and worshiped him according to the custom
Janamejaya said
Who is he in the form of a nakul with his head gold He said, "Speak this word like a human being.
Vaishampayana said

verse_data: एतत्पूर्वं न पृष्टोऽहं न चास्माभिः प्रभाषितम्
श्रूयतां नकुलो योऽसौ यथा वागस्य मानुषी

verse_translation.google_trans: I have never been asked before and we have not spoken Hear, Nakula, who is as the human being of speech.
Jamadagni resolved the shraddha in the past Homadhenustamagacca himself also milked her

verse_data: तत्क्षीरं स्थापयामास नवे भाण्डे दृढे शुचौ

verse_translation.google_trans: He placed the milk in the new vessel with firm cleansing And that anger turned into a ball in form
The best of the sages, who was curious, did he do it for the sake of displeasure. Thinking about this, the wicked man attacked the milk.

verse_data: तमाज्ञाय मुनिः क्रोधं नैवास्य चुकुपे ततः

verse_translation.google_trans: The sage, knowing him, did not become angry with him. That anger said to him and with folded hands he stood in the form
Bhrigu, the best of the Bhrigus, is very angry. This is a false proverb in the world that you have defeated me

verse_data: सोऽहं त्वयि स्थितो ह्यद्य क्षमावति महात्मनि
बिभेमि तपसः साधो प्रसादं कुरु मे विभो

verse_translation.google_trans: So I am standing in you, for I am forgiving, in the great soul. I am afraid of austerities, saintly, please do me, O Lord.
Jamadagniruvacha

verse_data: साक्षाद्दृष्टोऽसि मे क्रोध गच्छ त्वं विगतज्वरः
न ममापकृतं तेऽद्य न मन्युर्विद्यते मम

verse_translation.google_trans: You have seen me directly and go, you are free from fever. I have not wronged you today and I have no anger today

verse_data: यानुद्दिश्य तु संकल्पः पयसोऽस्य कृतो मया

verse_translation.google_trans: But I have made the resolution of the milk instructing him Your fathers, greatly fortunate, understand them to them.
When he was thus addressed he disappeared there From the abdomen of the ancestors, Nakula became

verse_data: तैश्चाप्युक्तो यदा धर्मं क्षेप्स्यसे मोक्ष्यसे तदा

verse_translation.google_trans: He appeased them and said that the end of the curse would be They also said when you will throw the Dharma, you will be saved.
They were also mentioned in the sacrificial places and the forests of Dharma. They ran after the contemptible and worshiped the sacrifice.
Then he threw the son of Dharma by Saktuprastha Freed from the curse, anger was the righteousness of Yudhisthira.
Thus this then happened in the sacrifice of the great soul And as they watched, Nakula disappeared there.
